alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Jones; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 8:32AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, northwestern Whiteside, southwestern Jo Daviess, western Carroll, Jackson, northeastern Cedar, northern Scott, southeastern Dubuque, southern Jones and Clinton Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 831 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bellevue to near Delmar to Stanwood. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Maquoketa, Stanwood, DeWitt, Camanche, Bellevue, Preston, Long Grove, Lowden, Wheatland, Olin, Grand Mound, Sabula, Delmar, Wyoming, Oxford Junction, Lost Nation, Miles, Calamus and Andrew. Those attending the Camanche Days are in the path of these storms and should prepare for strong wind gusts and occasional lightning. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 277 and 282. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
